setupForm.check.loading: Checking the security of your installation...
setupForm.check.unsecured.title: Your Airbyte installation is unsecured
setupForm.check.unsecured.open: Your Airbyte instance is reachable from the internet and doesn't use any form of authentication. This means that any data entered will be open to the public, including any access tokens and credentials. You should not continue before securing your installation.
setupForm.check.unsecured.defaultAuth: Your Airbyte installation is reachable from the internet and uses the default username and password. This is extremely dangerous, since it allows an attacker to easily get access to your system and gain access to your data, including access tokens and credentials you use in Airbyte.
setupForm.check.unsecured.hint: Please check our <lnk>Securing Airbyte documentation</lnk> for detailed instructions on securing your Airbyte installation. If you're not the administrator of your Airbyte installation, please contact them before continuing.
setupForm.check.overwrite: I am aware that running Airbyte unsecured will put my data at risk but still would like to continue.
setupForm.check.closed: The security check did not reveal any vulnerabilities. Your installation likely is secure.
setupForm.check.failed: The security of your Airbyte installation couldn't be checked. Please ensure your installation is <lnk>secured</lnk>. It should use strong authentication and/or not be accessible from the internet.

connectionForm.breakingChange.deprecated: A pending upgrade to {actor_name} requires your attention.

There is a new version available for the {actor_definition_name} {actor_type} connector which contains breaking changes. Upgrade your {actor_name} {actor_type} by {upgrade_deadline} to ensure continuous syncing. Otherwise, this connection will be automatically paused to prevent failure or unexpected behavior.
connectionForm.breakingChange.unsupporte: There is a new version available for the {actor_definition_name} {actor_type} connector which contains breaking changes. connectionForm.modal.destinationNamespac: Replicate the stream's source namespace in the destination.
Replicate and store in the default namespace defined in the destination settings.
Create a "custom format" to rename the namespace that your data will be replicated into.
Below is an example of how your data will be replicated with this namespace setting.  The example assumes a default destination namespace of "my_schema".
Note that if the source does not have a namespace, we will use the destination's schema as a fallback.
Note that if the source does not have a namespace, we will parse an empty string for the placeholder.  If the entire custom string is empty, we will use the destination's schema as a fallback.

  - No existing data in the destination will be altered

connectorBuilder.autoImportSchema.toolti:
Automatically sets the declared schema to the schema that is detected when clicking Test for this stream.

Disable this in order to manually edit the schema.
connectorBuilder.incremental.formatPlace:
Use placeholders starting with "%" to describe the format the API is using. The following placeholders are available:
* **%s**: Epoch unix timestamp - `1686218963`
* **%a**: Weekday (abbreviated) - `Sun`
* **%A**: Weekday (full) - `Sunday`
* **%w**: Weekday (decimal) - `0` (Sunday), `6` (Saturday)
* **%d**: Day of the month (zero-padded) - `01`, `02`, ..., `31`
* **%b**: Month (abbreviated) - `Jan`
* **%B**: Month (full) - `January`
* **%m**: Month (zero-padded) - `01`, `02`, ..., `12`
* **%y**: Year (without century, zero-padded) - `00`, `01`, ..., `99`
* **%Y**: Year (with century) - `0001`, `0002`, ..., `9999`
* **%H**: Hour (24-hour, zero-padded) - `00`, `01`, ..., `23`
* **%I**: Hour (12-hour, zero-padded) - `01`, `02`, ..., `12`
* **%p**: AM/PM indicator
* **%M**: Minute (zero-padded) - `00`, `01`, ..., `59`
* **%S**: Second (zero-padded) - `00`, `01`, ..., `59`
* **%f**: Microsecond (zero-padded to 6 digits) - `000000`
* **%z**: UTC offset - `(empty)`, `+0000`, `-04:00`
* **%Z**: Time zone name - `(empty)`, `UTC`, `GMT`
* **%j**: Day of the year (zero-padded) - `001`, `002`, ..., `366`
* **%U**: Week number of the year (starting Sunday) - `00`, ..., `53`
* **%W**: Week number of the year (starting Monday) - `00`, ..., `53`
* **%c**: Date and time - `Tue Aug 16 21:30:00 1988`
* **%x**: Date standard format - `08/16/1988`
* **%X**: Time standard format - `21:30:00`
* **%%**: Literal '%' character

Some placeholders depend on the locale of the underlying system - in most cases this locale is configured as en/US. For more information see the [Python documentation](https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#strftime-and-strptime-format-codes).

Are you sure you want to remove your dbt Service Token? 
 
This will stop all dbt Cloud transformations from running and may cause sync failures.  You will need to manually remove these transformations from your connections to keep syncing.
This workspace has an existing dbt service token.  To replace it, you must first remove the existing token.
To use the dbt Cloud integration, enter your service token here. <lnk>Learn more</lnk>.
